alert.note: Alert for Norfolk, Portsmouth; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:27PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the southeastern City of Norfolk and the northwestern City of Virginia Beach through 715 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kempsville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Virginia Wesleyan University, Regent University, Kempsville, Norfolk, Norfolk International, Rudee Heights, Princess Anne Plaza, Oceana NAS, Macons Corner, Bayside, Oceana, North Virginia Beach and London Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
